text: The Assembly of the People United–Democratic Party of Guinea-Bissau (, APU- PDGB) is a political party in Guinea-Bissau. ==History== The party was established in November 2014 by Nuno Gomes Nabiam following the April–May 2014 general elections, in which he was runner-up in the presidential contest.Formation of the APU Party APU-PDGB Prior to the 2019 parliamentary elections the party signed a coalition agreement with the African Party for the Independence of Guinea and Cape Verde.++ Ao minuto: PAIGC vence eleições na Guiné-Bissau ++ Deutsche Welle, 13 March 2019 It went on to receive 8.5% of the vote and won five seats in the National People's Assembly. ==References== ==External links== *Official website Category:Political parties in Guinea- Bissau Category:2014 establishments in Guinea-Bissau Category:Political parties established in 2014
title: Assembly of the People United
